definition: thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder

sentences.english: I never had a bone spur.
A body thin and small, and bony and thorny all over.
sentences.chinese: 瘦小的身子，且长满疙疙瘩瘩的骨刺。

sentences.english: But I would worry about SOME types of fish, like catfish with ecially sharp bones, not about normal smaller fish.
sentences.chinese: 但有些鱼不行，比如说有尖锐绿锦蛇骨刺的鲶鱼。

sentences.english: The thorn of bone may dislodge from his throat without surgery.
sentences.chinese: 也许不用动手术就能去除他喉咙卡着的那块骨刺。

sentences.english: I wonder what a bone spur is, he thought.
sentences.chinese: 不知道骨刺是什么玩意儿，他想。

sentences.english: If fracture was not cured, easy long spur?
sentences.chinese: 骨折要是不养好了，容易长骨刺吗？

sentences.english: Which friend has the method that treats knee joint spur excuse me?
sentences.chinese: 请问哪位朋友有治疗膝关节骨刺的方法？

sentences.english: But would the bone spur hurt him too much?
sentences.chinese: 但骨刺会不会很困扰他呢？

sentences.english: Used to eliminate all meat, fish head bone spur, shrimp and crab shell.
sentences.chinese: 所用肉类都先剔除骨头，鱼去头尾和骨刺，虾蟹去壳。
对了，我这会不会是“骨刺”呢？
